senses.de: To put something or someone in the place of another.
senses.ex: John couldn't come to work today, so Alex replaced him.

Tips.title: Temporary Replacement
Tips.description: Used when someone temporarily takes over another's duties or role.
Tips.example: Sara was ill, so Mark replaced her at the meeting.

Tips.title: Not Interchangeable
Tips.description: 'Replace' suggests a successor, not necessarily an identical substitute.
Tips.example: Our new teacher replaced Mr. Johnson; they have different teaching styles.

senses.de: To take the place of something or somebody.
senses.ex: The sequel to the movie replaced the original in popularity.

Tips.title: New Dominance
Tips.description: Implies that the replacement has taken over in importance or popularity.
Tips.example: Streaming services have replaced DVDs as the preferred way to watch movies.

Tips.title: Era Shift
Tips.description: Indicates a change of time or era, often technological or cultural.
Tips.example: Smartphones replaced flip phones in the 2000s.

senses.de: To fix something by putting a new part in place of the old one.
senses.ex: The mechanic replaced the car's broken engine.

Tips.title: Functional Restoration
Tips.description: Focus on restoring functionality, rather than making something new.
Tips.example: If your watch stops working, you might just need to replace the battery.

Tips.title: Repair with Parts
Tips.description: Usually involves exchanging a part, not fixing the original.
Tips.example: We replaced the worn-out tires with a new set.

senses.de: To substitute one string of characters, files or data by another in a file or sequence of commands.
senses.ex: You can use the replace function to change 'cats' to 'dogs' in your document.

Tips.title: Digital Substitution
Tips.description: Used when changing digital information like text or files.
Tips.example: To correct a repeated mistake, just replace 'there' with 'their'.

Tips.title: Batch Processing
Tips.description: Can be used for making multiple replacements at once in digital files.
Tips.example: Replace all uses of 'Color' with 'Colour' to adapt the text for UK readers.

Alternate.wordDefinition:
Alternate means to switch between two or more options or to take turns. For example, if you alternate between running and walking during a workout, you would run for a certain amount of time and then walk for a certain amount of time.

Alternate means to switch back and forth between options, while replace means to remove one thing and put a new thing in its place.

Exchange.wordDefinition:
Exchange refers to giving something in return for something else of equal value. For example, exchanging currency when traveling overseas.

Exchange is applicable when two parties are trading something, whereas replace is applicable when something needs to be substituted for another due to damage or ineffectiveness.

Fill in.wordDefinition:
Fill in means to add or provide what is missing or incomplete, while replace means to substitute something with something else.

For example, if you have a form that has blanks in it that need to be completed, you would use fill in to mean completing the blanks with the necessary information.

If you have a broken chair, you would use the word replace to mean getting rid of the broken chair and getting a new one in its place.

Essentially, to fill in means to complete something that is unfinished or incomplete, while to replace means to substitute one thing for another.

Substitute.wordDefinition:
The words replace and substitute both mean to use something instead of something else, but there are some differences in their usage.

Substitute means to use something different instead of the original thing. For example, if you don't have milk for a recipe, you can substitute it with water.

If you want to make something exactly the same as before, use replace. If you want to use something different, use substitute.

Succeed.wordDefinition:
Succeed means to achieve or accomplish something, often in place of someone else. For example, if a CEO retires, someone else might succeed them by taking their place as the head of the company.

Replace means to take the place of something or someone, while succeed means to achieve or take over from someone else in a specific role or position.

Supplant.wordDefinition:
Supplant means to remove something and replace it with something else, usually because the new thing is better. It's like saying the new thing has taken over the role of the old thing.

For example, a new technology might supplant an older one, or a new leader might supplant the old one.

So the difference is that replace is just swapping one thing for another, while supplant implies that the new thing is better or more important, and has replaced the old thing in that role.

Swap.wordDefinition:
Swap means to exchange something with someone else.

Example: I will swap my sandwich with your burger.

Replace is used when you are getting rid of something old or damaged and putting in something new, while swap is used when trading one thing for another, usually of equal value.

Take over.wordDefinition:
Replace means to substitute something or someone with a new thing or person, whereas take over means to take control or authority of something.

Take over would be useful when a company acquires another company, they take over that company's assets, employees, and management.

Replace means to substitute, while take over means to gain control or authority over something.

quotes.Text: It doesn't really matter what someone's hair looks like or if the sound is perfect. Every director who's made a couple of movies knows that, because you can replace the sound. Or, like, any one shot is not that important, because they all add up together.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Zal Batmanglij

quotes.Text: Getting to connect with new people in new parts of the world every week is a blessing, and when the crowd and music is right, nothing can replace that feeling.
quotes.Title: English
quotes.Name: Jax Jones

quotes.Text: When everything in a person's life is gone, ripped-out gone, it's not that you stay empty for so long, so you replace it with something else very quickly.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jim Parrack

quotes.Text: I knew that everybody could be replaced. Nobody lasts forever. And if you work for somebody, he's certainly got the privilege and the right to fire you.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Ernie Harwell

quotes.Text: Much of the social history of the Western world, over the past three decades, has been a history of replacing what worked with what sounded good.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Thomas Sowell

quotes.Text: If you read books forever and ever, they will never replace what really counts - that's practical experience.
quotes.Title: American Director
quotes.Name: Hal Needham

quotes.Text: Whenever someone says, 'You've changed my life,' you can't replace that.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Tempestt Bledsoe

quotes.Text: We live in a world in which politics has replaced philosophy.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Martin L. Gross

quotes.Text: That's the secret to life... replace one worry with another.
quotes.Title: American Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Charles M. Schulz

quotes.Text: It's not easy to replace the best centre-back in the world.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Athlete
quotes.Name: Fabinho
